abstract: Paris Journal; sites of massacre of 17 people in terrorist attacks on offices of Charlie Hebdo and at kosher market have been turned into shrines by visitors and mourners of all nationalities and faiths; some worry about how European countries will react; dignitaries like New York Mayor Bill de Blasio also pay respects.
lead_paragraph: At sites honoring the 17 who were killed by terrorists almost two weeks ago, people of various nationalities and faiths have visited and expressed concerns about how European countries will react.
snippet: At sites honoring the 17 who were killed by terrorists almost two weeks ago, people of various nationalities and faiths have visited and expressed concerns about how European countries will react.

headline.main: Mourners Bear Flowers and Hopes for Unabridged Liberty
headline.seo: At Sites Honoring Victims of Paris Attacks, Concerns About the Future
headline.print_headline: Mourners Bear Flowers and Hopes for Unabridged Liberty
